data.title: LinkedIn
data.meta_description:
AM | 2,307 followers on LinkedIn. Reimagine primary sources. Discover award-winning archival collections, learn how to use them, or create your own. | AM’s digital collections and technology platforms enrich the study, research and teaching of primary sources. We partner with libraries, archives and heritage institutions to digitise the world’s historical and cultural knowledge. 

With AM, customers can discover award-winning archival collections, learn how to use them, or create their own.
data.text:
Does your institution use audiovisual resources? A recent Library Journal survey reported that 57% of academic librarians have seen a rise in the usage of AV sources over the last three years. Take a look at our recent white paper and discover how you can enhance research and success by supporting the use of AV primary sources. Download your copy: https://okt.to/lW680U

Are you heading to the Society of American Archivists Annual Meeting next week? Make sure to connect with the AM team and attend our session 'Navigating the Crossroads: Improving Access to AV Collections with AM Quartex', August 15 at 17:30 CDT. Learn how Quartex can transform your digital archives with cutting-edge technologies, to provide exceptional discovery and accessibility capabilities. We hope to see you there!

The last time Paris hosted the Olympic Games, only 4.4% of participants were women. Fast-forward to #Paris2024, where 50% of the 10,500 athletes are female. Take a look at the history of gender equality in sport with our upcoming resource, The Olympic Movement: Sport, Global Politics and Identity. Find out more: https://okt.to/r0pHuy

Are you at ASERL conference? We'd love to hear which sessions you've participated in. The demonstrations on Robotics, AI, and VR have been truly impressive, showcasing the significant impact of technology on libraries and academia. We are proud to sponsor and take part in such a remarkable event. #ASERL

Did you know that tug of war was once an Olympic sport? It featured in the Summer Olympics from 1900 to 1920. Interestingly, countries could enter multiple teams in the competition, allowing them to sweep the podium. In 1904, the United States achieved this feat, winning all three medals, and in 1908, British teams took all the top spots. Curious about other sports no longer included in the Olympic games? Find out more in our upcoming resource, The Olympic Movement: Sport, Global Politics and Identity: https://okt.to/Kb1oyP

Join us at the ASERL Technology Immersion Conference 2024. Anthony V. and Lindsay Gulliver will be hosting a Lunch and Learn session titled Reimagine: Innovations for Discovery, Accessibility, and Inclusion. Mark your diaries for Wednesday 7 August from 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM. Don't miss out on this opportunity to explore the future of library technology and connect with like-minded colleagues. #ASERL

In this webinar, hear from AM's Jameson Worley about how public libraries, such as Burlington Public Library, are building community around their local heritage collections with AM Quartex. Learn from inspiring examples how you can enhance accessibility for the communities whose stories are being told. Watch on demand: https://okt.to/VvKa38

We are excited to announce that we're attending the ASERL Technology Immersion Conference 2024, taking place at the University of Alabama, Birmingham, from August 7 to 9. Join us to discuss the latest technology alongside fellow library professionals. We look forward to connecting and sharing valuable insights! #ASERL

Did you know that the Summer Olympics were last held in Paris 100 years ago? Uncover the pivotal nature of Paris 1924 in our upcoming AM collection, The Olympic Movement: Sport, Global Politics and Identity. Discover the chronology of the 1924 Olympics and contextualise the gold medals alongside a broader historical framework. Request a free trial of the collection: https://okt.to/Vzts3g

Part of our mission at AM is to be accountable and support our community. One way we do this is through our staff volunteer days. Recently, some of our team joined Action for the River Kennet (ARK) to plant crowfoot in the River Kennet and help with ARK's annual Himalayan Balsam programme on the River Enborne. We're really proud of our team's commitment to helping our community. Together we're making a difference!
